contents.item: Think of tomorrow, the past can't be mended.
We should use our imagination more than our memory.

Our ability to look back on the past, our need or desire to make sense of it, is both a blessing and a curse; and our inability to see into the future with any degree of accuracy is, simultaneously, the thing that saves us and the thing that condemns us.
contents.owner: James Robertson, And the Land Lay Still

contents.item: Your history is not your future.
She mourned the history that the invisible intruder had erased, but not enough that she would spend a second more of her future feeling the emptiness.
My history is my step to future , whatever the history was full of garbage, but I can get over it and get to the TOP with my History
History would be a revelation of the future as much as it was a study of the past.
contents.owner: Arundhati Roy, The Ministry of Utmost Happiness

contents.item: future could be read much more clearly in the streets, factories, and barracks than in the morning press.
contents.owner: Carlos Ruiz Zafón, The Shadow of the Wind

contents.item: It’s no longer history in the making. It’s our story we are making.
Music is the building block for things yet to come.
History Is The BACKBONEOf FutureLearn and Grow

No matter how troubled a character's history, romance novels tell us, love can be built upon it, and happily-ever-after can result. What's more, the darker the past, the brighter the future - and the better the read.
We need a new ethic of place, one that has room for salmon and skyscrapers, suburbs and wilderness, Mount Rainier and the Space Needle, one grounded in history.
contents.owner: Matthew Klingle, Emerald City: An Environmental History of Seattle

contents.item: The danger of the past was that men became slaves. The danger of the future is that men may become robots.
In the United States, there was no simpler, more agreeable time.
contents.owner: Sarah Vowell, Lafayette in the Somewhat United States

contents.item: Today is the beginning of new history.
contents.owner: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

contents.item: Who doesn’t respect and value his past, is not worth the honour of the present, and has no right to a future.
But I can't rewrite history. I can only live with what's left.
The 90’s map the decades to come – full of invisible technologies that will ‘sub-contract’ many of the functions of the central nervous system.
Thou, too, sail on, O Ship of State! Sail on, O Union, strong and great! Humanity with all its fears, With all the hopes of future years, Is hanging breathless on thy fate!
